awd_titl_txt: Organic Soluble Molecules with Functionalized Cavities
awd_abstract_narration: This research project in the Organic and Macromolecular Chemistry               Program is designed to provide deeper understanding of the                      relationship of molecular structure to reactivity in organic                    compounds.                                                                                                                                                      The molecular concept of host systems for general organic guest                 compounds, based on hydrophobic binding of the guest in aqueous                 solution, is deficient in several respects.  This project is will               investigate certain molecular architecture principals for                       designing hosts that are guest-sticky in hydrophobic solvents.                  Particular areas of interests are: (1) concave functionality and                the importance of preorganization; (2) the relationship between                 guest rigidity and reaction rate; (3) intracavity chemistry; and                (4) Computer assisted molecular architecture.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
